title: Contributing to uprobot
text: outlines propose change uprobot. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to uprobot
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to uprobot
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to uprobot
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("jumpingrivers/uprobot", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to uprobot
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to uprobot
text: Please note uprobot project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rivers J (2022). uprobot: Uptime robot API. R package version 0.1.1, https://jumpingrivers.github.io/uprobot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {uprobot: Uptime robot API},   author = {Jumping Rivers},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.1},   url = {https://jumpingrivers.github.io/uprobot/}, }

title: Uptime robot API
text: Grab data uptime robot via ’s API. package include features API functions , missing arguments get key log uptime robot settings API Settings. recommend monitor specific API keys avoid mistakes

title: Uptime robot API
text: Install package usual way use package, need upRobot account API key (see ). can either pass API key explicity, set environmental variable UPTIME_ROBOT_TOKEN .Renviron
code: remotes::install_github("jumpingrivers/uprobot") library("uprobot") mon = get_monitors(api_key = "XXX", logs = TRUE) mon$logs # If set in your .Renviron # get_monitors(logs = TRUE)

what: Get Uptime Robot account details — get_account_details
title: Get Uptime Robot account details — get_account_details
Get Uptime Robot account details — get_account_details
Get Uptime Robot account details — get_account_details
Get monitors — get_monitors
code: get_monitors(   api_key,   logs = FALSE,   all_uptime_ratio = FALSE,   all_time_uptime_durations = FALSE,   custom_uptime_ratios = NULL,   response_times = FALSE )

title: Get monitors — get_monitors
text: api_key api_key logs logs returned (default FALSE) all_uptime_ratio Uptime ratio since monitoring began (default FALSE). all_time_uptime_durations time uptime durations (default FALSE). custom_uptime_ratios Defines number days calculate uptime ratio(s) . Ex: custom_uptime_ratios=7-30-45 get uptime ratios periods. response_times Logical default FALSE.

title: Get monitors — get_monitors
text: argument order may change. use named arguments. also want make function always return tibble number columns. However, api really consistent depends arguments passed.
